name: Commercial Lighting, IECC Std. c. 2009

energy_efficiency_source.notes: See page 59, table 505.5.2; use Scout Cost Conversion Data on 1000 lm/ft^2 floor to get from original 1.122 W/ft^2 floor -> 43.67 lm/W

source_data.title: Scout Cost Conversion Data
source_data.author: Langevin, J.
source_data.organization: U.S. Department of Energy, Building Technologies Office

installed_cost_source.notes: Assumes linear fluorescent as the dominant commercial lighting type, uses 2010 T8 bulb type costs for 'linear fluorescent' lamp type in EIA NEMS 'rsmlgt.txt' file; converts from $/bulb to $/1000 lm by assuming 32 W/lamp, 1.122 W/ft^2 floor from IECC standard, and 0.049 lm/ft^2 floor from Scout Cost Conversion Data

source_data.title: Residential Demand Module of the National Energy Modeling System: Model Documentation
Scout Cost Conversion Data
source_data.author: Langevin, J.
source_data.organization: U.S. Department of Energy, Building Technologies Office

product_lifetime_source.notes: Assumes linear fluorescent as the dominant commercial lighting type, use 2010 T8 bulb type lifetime for 'linear fluorescent' lamp type in EIA NEMS 'rsmlgt.txt' file, with 12 hours of assumed use per day

source_data.title: Residential Demand Module of the National Energy Modeling System: Model Documentation

_description: Commercial lighting that meets the IECC performance standard in 2010
_notes: Assumes linear fluorescent as the dominant commercial lighting type and T8 as the dominant bulb type in estimating cost/lifetime
